citations.narrative:
The Program of Veterinary care (PVC) indicates adult dogs should be vaccinated once per year to protect against
parvovirus and distemper, however the facility representative thinks it was longer than a year ago. Treatment records
lacked any indication that the adults have been updated on parvo and distemper vaccines in the last year. Keeping adult
dogs up to date on their vaccines is important to help prevent dogs from getting sick. Ensure to get the adult dogs
updated on their parvovirus and distemper vaccines per the PVC and per the Attending Veterinarian's (AV) guidance
(contact the AV and follow their guidance on when to vaccinate pregnant or lactating dogs).
***Correct by 1/8/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The Program of Veterinary care (PVC) indicates adult dogs should be vaccinated once per year to protect against 
parvovirus and distemper, however the facility representative thinks it was longer than a year ago. Treatment records 
lacked any indication that the adults have been updated on parvo and distemper vaccines in the last year. Keeping adult 
dogs up to date on their vaccines is important to help prevent dogs from getting sick. Ensure to get the adult dogs 
updated on their parvovirus and distemper vaccines per the PVC and per the Attending Veterinarian's (AV) guidance 
(contact the AV and follow their guidance on when to vaccinate pregnant or lactating dogs). 
***Correct by 1/8/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
